description: Update CLAUDE.md and admin development documentation to clarify when to use standard Refine CRUD patterns vs custom implementations. Add guidelines: 1) Use standard CRUD (useTable, useEdit, useForm) for simple admin data operations: user management, audit logs, settings, API keys, document listings, 2) Use custom implementations for complex domain logic: Temporal workflows, analytics aggregations, approval workflows, business-specific operations, 3) Reference Refine.dev documentation: https://refine.dev/core/docs/data/hooks/use-table/, https://refine.dev/core/docs/data/data-provider/, 4) Provide examples of both patterns, 5) Document resource configuration patterns, 6) Show nestjs-query integration examples. This prevents future over-engineering of simple admin tasks.
title: Document Refine.dev CRUD Patterns for Admin Development
